description.other_details: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/.

This artefact includes content from SNOMED Clinical Terms® (SNOMED CT®) which is copyrighted material of the International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO). Where an implementation of this artefact makes use of SNOMED CT content, the implementer must have the appropriate SNOMED CT Affiliate license - for more information contact https://www.snomed.org/snomed-ct/get-snomed or info@snomed.org.

details.purpose: *To record a narrative description and clinical interpretation of the cervical findings obtained by manual palpation. (en)
details.use:
*Use to record a narrative description and clinical interpretation of the findings obtained by manual palpation of the cervix, such as a bimanual examination during pregnancy or labour.
This archetype has been specifically designed to be used in the 'Examination detail' SLOT within the CLUSTER.exam-palpation_vagina or OBSERVATION.exam archetypes, but can also be used within other ENTRY or CLUSTER archetypes, where clinically appropriate.
Use to provide a framework in which CLUSTER archetypes can be nested in the 'Examination findings' SLOT to record additional structured physical examination findings.
The CLUSTER.exclusion_exam archetype can be nested within the 'Examination not done' SLOT to optionally record explicit details about the examination not being performed.
Use to incorporate the narrative descriptions of clinical findings within existing or legacy clinical systems into an archetyped format, using the 'Clinical Description' data element. (en)
details.misuse:
*Not to be used to record findings about the visual observation of the cervix during a speculum examination. Use CLUSTER.exam-inspection_cervix for this purpose.
Not to be used for recording the clinical history - use specific OBSERVATION and CLUSTER archetypes. For example OBSERVATION.story and CLUSTER.symptom_sign.
Not to be used for recording the results of an imaging examination - use the CLUSTER.imaging_exam family of archetypes for this purpose. (en)

details.purpose: *To record a narrative description and clinical interpretation of the cervical findings obtained by manual palpation. (en)
details.keywords: fynd, undersökningsfynd, fysisk undersökning, u.a., utan anmärkning

translations.author: Nina Schewe, Natalia Strauch, Darin Leonhardt
Medizinische Hochschule Hannover, PLRI für medizinische Informatik/ Medizinische Hochschule
schewe.nina@mh-hannover.de, Strauch.Natalia@mh-hannover.de, leonhardt.darin@mh-hannover.de
Silje Ljosland Bakke, Vebjørn Arntzen
Nasjonal IKT HF, Oslo University Hospital
varntzen@ous-hf.no

items.items: Identification of the examined body system or anatomical structure.
Coding of the system or structure examined with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Narrative description of the overall findings observed during the physical examination.
Structured details about the physical examination findings.
Digital image, video or diagram representing the physical examination findings.
Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the physical examination findings.
For example: 'No abnormality detected' or 'Moderate inflammation present'. Coding of the 'Clinical interpretation' with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Additional narrative about the physical examination findings, not captured in other fields.
Details to explicitly record that this examination was not performed.
A structured description of the area of the body under examination.
If the body site has been fully identified in the 'System or structure examined' or the 'Body site' data element, this SLOT becomes redundant.
Identification of the area of the body under examination.
For example examination of a specific area of skin. If the body site has been fully identified in the 'System or structure examined' data element, this data element becomes redundant.
Findings obtained by manual palpation of the cervix.
Identification of the examined body system or anatomical structure.
Coding of the system or structure examined with a terminology is preferred, where possible.
Actual cervical position in relation to the expected, central anatomical position.
The cervix is pointing anteriorly, towards the pubis.
The cervix is located centrally, in the typical anatomical position.
The cervix is pointing posteriorly, towards the sacrum.
The cervix is pointing towards the left side of the pelvis.
The cervix is pointing towards the right side of the pelvis.
The cervix feels firm or hard.
The cervix feels neither firm nor soft.
The cervix feels soft or ripe.
Narrative description about the surface of the cervix.
Narrative description of the mobility of the cervix.
Narrative description about any tenderness associated with the cervix, especially on movement.
Relative distance from the internal os to the external surface of the cervix.
The cervix is thickened and swollen.
Estimation of the amount of cervical effacement, usually related to late pregnancy or labour.
Estimation of the length of the cervix during late pregnancy or labour.
Application of the cervix to the presenting part of the fetus during late pregnancy or labour.
Cervix is not moulded to the fetal presenting part.
Cervix is closely moulded to the fetal presenting part.
An anterior lip is not present.
The amount of dilation of the external opening of the cervix.
The amount of dilation of the internal opening of the cervix to the uterus.
Identifisering av det undersøkte organsystemet eller den anatomiske strukturen.
Det anbefales å kode organsystem eller den anatomiske strukturen med en terminologi dersom mulig.
Fritekstbeskrivelse av de overordnede funnene ved den fysiske undersøkelsen.
Digitale bilder, video eller diagram som representerer undersøkelsesfunnene.
Enkelt ord, setning, frase eller kort beskrivelse som representerer den kliniske betydning og viktigheten av funnene ved den fysiske undersøkelsen.
For eksempel "Uten anmerkning" eller "Moderat inflammasjon". Det anbefales å kode "Fortolkning" med en terminologi dersom mulig.
Ytterligere fritekst om funn ved undersøkelsen, som ikke dekkes av andre elementer.
Detaljer for å eksplisitt registrere at denne undersøkelsen ikke ble utført.
Angivelse av en strukturert anatomisk lokalisering av det undersøkte organsystemet eller den anatomiske strukturen.
Hvis anatomisk lokalisasjon er entydig identifisert i elementet "Undersøkt organsystem eller struktur" er dette SLOT'et ikke nødvendig å benytte.
Identifisering av et enkelt fysisk sted enten på eller i menneskekroppen.

For eksempel undersøkelse av et spesifikt område på huden. Dersom den anatomiske lokaliseringen allerede er identifisert i elementet "Undersøkt organsystem eller struktur" er dette dataelementet overflødig.
*Findings obtained by manual palpation of the cervix. (en)
Identifisering av det undersøkte organsystemet eller den anatomiske strukturen.
Det anbefales å kode organsystem eller den anatomiske strukturen med en terminologi dersom mulig.
*Actual cervical position in relation to the expected, central anatomical position. (en)
*The cervix is pointing anteriorly, towards the pubis. (en)
*The cervix is located centrally, in the typical anatomical position. (en)
*The cervix is pointing posteriorly, towards the sacrum. (en)
*The cervix is pointing towards the left side of the pelvis. (en)
*The cervix is pointing towards the right side of the pelvis. (en)
*The cervix feels neither firm nor soft. (en)
*Narrative description about the surface of the cervix. (en)
*Narrative description of the mobility of the cervix (en).
*Narrative description about any tenderness associated with the cervix, especially on movement. (en)
*Relative distance from the internal os to the external surface of the cervix. (en)
*Estimation of the amount of cervical effacement, usually related to late pregnancy or labour. (en)
*Estimation of the length of the cervix during late pregnancy or labour. (en)
*Application of the cervix to the presenting part of the fetus during late pregnancy or labour. (en)
*Cervix is not moulded to the fetal presenting part. (en)
*Cervix is closely moulded to the fetal presenting part. (en)
*The amount of dilation of the external opening of the cervix. (en)
*The amount of dilation of the internal opening of the cervix to the uterus. (en)
Identificação do sistema do corpo examinado ou da estrutura anatômica.
A codificação do sistema ou estrutura examinada com uma terminologia é preferível, sempre que possível.
Descrição narrativa dos achados gerais observados durante o exame físico.
Detalhes estruturados sobre os resultados do exame físico.
Imagem digital, vídeo ou diagrama representando os achados do exame físico.
Palavra, frase ou breve descrição que represente o significado clínico e o significado dos resultados do exame físico.
*For example: 'No abnormality detected' or 'Moderate inflammation present'. Coding of the 'Clinical interpretation' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. (en)
Narrativa adicional sobre os achados do exame físico, não capturados em outros campos.
Detalhes para registrar explicitamente que esse exame não foi realizado.
Uma descrição estruturada da área do corpo em exame.
Se o local do corpo tiver sido totalmente identificado no elemento de dados 'Sistema ou estrutura examinada' ou 'Local do corpo', esse SLOT se tornará redundante.
*Identification of the area of the body under examination. (en)
*For example examination of a specific area of skin. If the body site has been fully identified in the 'System or structure examined' data element, this data element becomes redundant. (en)
*Findings obtained by manual palpation of the cervix. (en)
Identificação do sistema do corpo examinado ou da estrutura anatômica.
A codificação do sistema ou estrutura examinada com uma terminologia é preferível, sempre que possível.
*Actual cervical position in relation to the expected, central anatomical position. (en)
*The cervix is pointing anteriorly, towards the pubis. (en)
*The cervix is located centrally, in the typical anatomical position. (en)
*The cervix is pointing posteriorly, towards the sacrum. (en)
*The cervix is pointing towards the left side of the pelvis. (en)
*The cervix is pointing towards the right side of the pelvis. (en)
*The cervix feels neither firm nor soft. (en)
*Narrative description about the surface of the cervix. (en)
*Narrative description of the mobility of the cervix (en).
*Narrative description about any tenderness associated with the cervix, especially on movement. (en)
*Relative distance from the internal os to the external surface of the cervix. (en)
*Estimation of the amount of cervical effacement, usually related to late pregnancy or labour. (en)
*Estimation of the length of the cervix during late pregnancy or labour. (en)
*Application of the cervix to the presenting part of the fetus during late pregnancy or labour. (en)
*Cervix is not moulded to the fetal presenting part. (en)
*Cervix is closely moulded to the fetal presenting part. (en)
*The amount of dilation of the external opening of the cervix. (en)
*The amount of dilation of the internal opening of the cervix to the uterus. (en)
Identifizierung des untersuchten Körpersystems oder der anatomischen Struktur.
Wenn möglich wird die Kodierung des untersuchten Systems oder der untersuchten Struktur mit einer Terminologie bevorzugt.
Beschreibung der bei der körperlichen Untersuchung beobachteten Gesamtbefunde.
Strukturierte Angaben zu den Ergebnissen der körperlichen Untersuchung.
Digitales Bild, Video oder Diagramm, das die Ergebnisse der körperlichen Untersuchung darstellt.
Ein einzelnes Wort, eine Phrase oder eine kurze Beschreibung, die die klinische Bedeutung und Wichtigkeit der Untersuchungsergebnisse darstellt.
Zum Beispiel: „Ohne Befund“ oder „Mäßige Entzündung vorhanden“. Wenn möglich, wird die Codierung der „Klinischen Interpretation“ mit einer Terminologie bevorzugt.
Zusätzliche Beschreibung der Ergebnisse der körperlichen Untersuchung, die in anderen Bereichen nicht erfasst werden konnten.
Eine Aussage die ausdrücklich erfasst, dass die Untersuchung nicht durchgeführt wurde.
Eine strukturierte Beschreibung des zu untersuchenden Körperbereichs.
Wenn die Körperstelle im Datenelement "Untersuchtes System oder untersuchte Struktur" oder im Datenelement "Körperstelle" vollständig identifiziert wurde, wird die Verwendung dieses SLOT überflüssig.

Zum Beispiel die Untersuchung einer bestimmten Hautpartie. Wenn die Körperstelle im Datenelement „Untersuchtes System oder Struktur“ vollständig identifiziert wurde, wird dieses Datenelement überflüssig.
*Findings obtained by manual palpation of the cervix. (en)
Identifizierung des untersuchten Körpersystems oder der anatomischen Struktur.
Wenn möglich wird die Kodierung des untersuchten Systems oder der untersuchten Struktur mit einer Terminologie bevorzugt.
*Actual cervical position in relation to the expected, central anatomical position. (en)
*The cervix is pointing anteriorly, towards the pubis. (en)
*The cervix is located centrally, in the typical anatomical position. (en)
*The cervix is pointing posteriorly, towards the sacrum. (en)
*The cervix is pointing towards the left side of the pelvis. (en)
*The cervix is pointing towards the right side of the pelvis. (en)
*The cervix feels neither firm nor soft. (en)
*Narrative description about the surface of the cervix. (en)
*Narrative description of the mobility of the cervix (en).
*Narrative description about any tenderness associated with the cervix, especially on movement. (en)
*Relative distance from the internal os to the external surface of the cervix. (en)
*Estimation of the amount of cervical effacement, usually related to late pregnancy or labour. (en)
*Estimation of the length of the cervix during late pregnancy or labour. (en)
*Application of the cervix to the presenting part of the fetus during late pregnancy or labour. (en)
*Cervix is not moulded to the fetal presenting part. (en)
*Cervix is closely moulded to the fetal presenting part. (en)
*The amount of dilation of the external opening of the cervix. (en)
*The amount of dilation of the internal opening of the cervix to the uterus. (en)
Identifiering av systemet eller strukturen som undersökts.
Om möjligt, koda systemet eller strukturen med hjälp av ett terminologisystem.
En övergripande beskrivning av fynden från den fysiska undersökningen.
Strukturerade detaljer om fynd vid den fysiska undersökningen.
Digital bild, video eller diagram som återger fynd från undersökningen.
Ord, fras eller kort beskrivning av fyndens kliniska betydelse.
*For example: 'No abnormality detected' or 'Moderate inflammation present'. Coding of the 'Clinical interpretation' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. (en)
Kommentarer avseende undersökningsfynd som inte beskrivs i övriga fält.
Detaljerad beskrivning om att undersökningen inte genomfördes.
Strukturerad beskrivning av den anatomiska platsen som undersökts.
Om den anatomiska platsen kan identifieras helt via dataelementet "System eller struktur som undersökts" så blir denna del redundant.
*Identification of the area of the body under examination. (en)
*For example examination of a specific area of skin. If the body site has been fully identified in the 'System or structure examined' data element, this data element becomes redundant. (en)
*Findings obtained by manual palpation of the cervix. (en)
Identifiering av systemet eller strukturen som undersökts.
Om möjligt, koda systemet eller strukturen med hjälp av ett terminologisystem.
*Actual cervical position in relation to the expected, central anatomical position. (en)
*The cervix is pointing anteriorly, towards the pubis. (en)
*The cervix is located centrally, in the typical anatomical position. (en)
*The cervix is pointing posteriorly, towards the sacrum. (en)
*The cervix is pointing towards the left side of the pelvis. (en)
*The cervix is pointing towards the right side of the pelvis. (en)
*The cervix feels neither firm nor soft. (en)
*Narrative description about the surface of the cervix. (en)
*Narrative description of the mobility of the cervix (en).
*Narrative description about any tenderness associated with the cervix, especially on movement. (en)
*Relative distance from the internal os to the external surface of the cervix. (en)
*Estimation of the amount of cervical effacement, usually related to late pregnancy or labour. (en)
*Estimation of the length of the cervix during late pregnancy or labour. (en)
*Application of the cervix to the presenting part of the fetus during late pregnancy or labour. (en)
*Cervix is not moulded to the fetal presenting part. (en)
*Cervix is closely moulded to the fetal presenting part. (en)
*The amount of dilation of the external opening of the cervix. (en)
*The amount of dilation of the internal opening of the cervix to the uterus. (en)
Ταυτοποίηση του εξεταζόμενου συστήματος σώματος ή ανατομικής δομής.
Προτιμάται η κωδικοποίηση του συστήματος ή της δομής που εξετάζεται με ορολογία, όπου είναι δυνατόν.
Αφηγηματική περιγραφή των συνολικών ευρημάτων που παρατηρήθηκαν κατά τη διάρκεια της φυσικής εξέτασης.
Δομημένες λεπτομέρειες σχετικά με τα ευρήματα της φυσικής εξέτασης.
Ψηφιακή εικόνα, βίντεο ή διάγραμμα που αναπαριστά τα ευρήματα της φυσικής εξέτασης.
Μία λέξη, φράση ή σύντομη περιγραφή που αντιπροσωπεύει την κλινική σημασία και σημασία των ευρημάτων της φυσικής εξέτασης.
Για παράδειγμα: «Δεν ανιχνεύθηκε ανωμαλία» ή «Υπάρχει μέτρια φλεγμονή». Προτιμάται η κωδικοποίηση της «κλινικής ερμηνείας» με ορολογία, όπου είναι δυνατόν.
Πρόσθετη αφήγηση σχετικά με τα ευρήματα της φυσικής εξέτασης, που δεν αποτυπώνεται σε άλλους τομείς.
Λεπτομέρειες για να καταγραφεί ρητά ότι αυτή η εξέταση δεν διενεργήθηκε.
περιγραφή της περιοχής του υπό εξέταση σώματος.
*If the body site has been fully identified in the 'System or structure examined' or the 'Body site' data element, this SLOT becomes redundant.(en)
*Identification of the area of the body under examination. (en)
*For example examination of a specific area of skin. If the body site has been fully identified in the 'System or structure examined' data element, this data element becomes redundant. (en)
*Findings obtained by manual palpation of the cervix. (en)
Ταυτοποίηση του εξεταζόμενου συστήματος σώματος ή ανατομικής δομής.
Προτιμάται η κωδικοποίηση του συστήματος ή της δομής που εξετάζεται με ορολογία, όπου είναι δυνατόν.
*Actual cervical position in relation to the expected, central anatomical position. (en)
*The cervix is pointing anteriorly, towards the pubis. (en)
*The cervix is located centrally, in the typical anatomical position. (en)
*The cervix is pointing posteriorly, towards the sacrum. (en)
*The cervix is pointing towards the left side of the pelvis. (en)
*The cervix is pointing towards the right side of the pelvis. (en)
*The cervix feels neither firm nor soft. (en)
*Narrative description about the surface of the cervix. (en)
*Narrative description of the mobility of the cervix (en).
*Narrative description about any tenderness associated with the cervix, especially on movement. (en)
*Relative distance from the internal os to the external surface of the cervix. (en)
*Estimation of the amount of cervical effacement, usually related to late pregnancy or labour. (en)
*Estimation of the length of the cervix during late pregnancy or labour. (en)
*Application of the cervix to the presenting part of the fetus during late pregnancy or labour. (en)
*Cervix is not moulded to the fetal presenting part. (en)
*Cervix is closely moulded to the fetal presenting part. (en)
*The amount of dilation of the external opening of the cervix. (en)
*The amount of dilation of the internal opening of the cervix to the uterus. (en)
*Identification of the examined body system or anatomical structure.(en)
*Coding of the system or structure examined with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*Narrative description of the overall findings observed during the physical examination.(en)
*Structured details about the physical examination findings.(en)
*Digital image, video or diagram representing the physical examination findings.(en)
*Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of the physical examination findings.(en)
*For example: 'No abnormality detected' or 'Moderate inflammation present'. Coding of the 'Clinical interpretation' with a terminology is preferred, where possible.(en)
*Additional narrative about the physical examination findings, not captured in other fields.(en)
*Details to explicitly record that this examination was not performed.(en)
*A structured description of the area of the body under examination.(en)
*If the body site has been fully identified in the 'System or structure examined' or the 'Body site' data element, this SLOT becomes redundant.(en)
*Identification of the area of the body under examination. (en)
*For example examination of a specific area of skin. If the body site has been fully identified in the 'System or structure examined' data element, this data element becomes redundant. (en)
